com.fortify.processrunner

Class RunProcessRunnerFromCLI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fortify.processrunner.RunProcessRunnerFromCLI

  • public class RunProcessRunnerFromCLI
extends Object

    This class is the main entry point for running arbitrary processes. Based on the '-configFile' command line parameter, this class will instantiate and run a RunProcessRunnerFromSpringConfig instance, which loads the process-related definitions from a Spring configuration file.

    Other responsibilities for this class include the following:

    • Parse any process-specific command line parameters, to be provided to RunProcessRunnerFromSpringConfig
    • Initialize logging based on the '-logFile' and '-logLevel' command line parameters
    • Update command line parameter values based on default values provided through RunProcessRunnerFromSpringConfig configuration
    • Print help information if the '-help' option is specified, taking into account the process definition loaded through RunProcessRunnerFromSpringConfig
    Author:
    Ruud Senden

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultLogFileName

        protected static final String getDefaultLogFileName()
        Get the default log file name. If the current jar name that we are running from is known, the log file will have the same name as the jar name but with '.log' extension. If the jar name is not known, the default log file name will be 'processrunner.log'.
        Returns:
        Default log file name

      • run

        public final void run(String[] args)
        Main method for running a process. This method performs the following actions:
        • Initial parse of CLI options to identify configuration file and logging options
        • Instantiate RunProcessRunnerFromSpringConfig with the provided configuration file
        • Re-parse CLI options based on CLIOptionDefinitions provided by RunProcessRunnerFromSpringConfig
        • Log a warning for any unknown command line options
        • Print help information if the '-help' option was specified, or if no configuration file was specified
        • Invoke RunProcessRunnerFromSpringConfig to actually run the process
        Parameters:
        args -

      • addCLIOptionDefaultValuesToContext

        protected final void addCLIOptionDefaultValuesToContext(CLIOptionDefinitions cliOptionDefinitions,
                                                        Context context)
        Add the default values to the Context for any CLI options that do not yet have a value (i.e. not specified on the command line). This is necessary as we cannot access the default value from CLIOptionDefinition in the following cases:
        • The default value was updated on a copy of CLIOptionDefinition, whereas the application code is accessing the original CLIOptionDefinition instance.
        • The value is accessed from the Context directly, for example when accessing CLI options through Spring expressions.
        Parameters:
        cliOptionDefinitions -
        context -
